results.name: Number of runs of even length in base-9 representation of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
example: For n = 810 = 729 + 81 = 9^3 + 9^2 thus in base 9 written as "1100", we count two runs, both of length 2, thus both even, so a(810) = 2.
For n = 32805 = 5*(9^4), thus in base 9 "50000", there is one run of even length, so a(32805) = 1.
For n = 65630 = 1*(9^5) + 1*(9^4) + 0*(9^3) + 0*(9^2) + 2*(9^1) + 2*(9^0) thus written as "110022" in base 9, there are three runs, all of length 2, thus all even, so a(65630) = 3.
maple: for j from i+1 to d while Q[j] = Q[i] do od:
program: (PARI) A044940(n) = { my(rl=1, d, prev_d = -1, s=0); while(n>0, d = (n%9); n = ((n-d)/9); if(d==prev_d, rl++, s += (1-(rl%2)); prev_d = d; rl = 1)); (s + (1-(rl%2))); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 15 2017
